change.item: Conditions Governing Use note changed because restriction on use was lifted on January 1, 2020. UK SCRC boilerplate text for Conditions Governing Use note used instead of previous restriction. Original restriction stated, "Commercial use of the materials is expressly forbidden. The audio recordings may only be used for commercial purposes by or for the Sullivan family or with written permission from the Sullivan family until the year 2020 - at which point the materials will no longer be under restriction."

repository.corpname: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: The Claude Sullivan audio recordings are comprised of several hundred reel to reel tapes documenting his broadcasting career in sports radio.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the University of Kentucky. The University of Kentucky holds the copyright for materials created in the course of business by University of Kentucky employees. Copyright for all other materials has not been assigned to the University of Kentucky. For information about permission to reproduce or publish, please contact the Special Collections Research Center.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: In 2008, the original reel to reel tapes were cleaned, respooled, rehoused, and digitized.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 2006ua070: [Identification of item], Claude Sullivan audio recordings, 1944-2006, University of Kentucky Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Sportscaster Claude H. Sullivan (December 29, 1924 - December 9, 1967) was born in Winchester and died in Rochester, Minnesota. He attended the University of Louisville and Ohio State University. He began his broadcast career on the air at WMCA in Ashland in 1942. From 1944 to 1946, he was with WAVE in Louisville, and he began broadcasting University of Kentucky football games in 1945. From 1951 until 1962 Sullivan was associated with WVLK in Lexington broadcasting UK football and basketball games. Sullivan also worked for WKLX from 1947-1951 and also had brief jobs at WNOX in Knoxville, TN, in Mt. Vernon, ILL, and WZIP in Covington, KY in 1948. In 1951, he organized the Standard Oil Sports Network, which included more than twenty stations carrying football and basketball broadcasts originating in thirty- seven states. Named Kentucky's Outstanding Broadcaster by the National Association of Sportscasters and Sportswriters from 1959 to 1966, Sullivan received the Golden Mike award from the Kentucky Broadcaster's Award in 1967. He was buried in the Winchester Cemetery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Claude Sullivan audio recordings are comprised of several hundred reel to reel tapes. The recordings document Sullivan's sports shows, game coverage, overseas tours, interviews, and his hall of fame induction. The audio recordings cover UK football, UK basketball, baseball, horse racing, boxing, various interviews, high school basketball, the Sullivan Sports Show, and WVLK Europe tours. The tapes do not include all of his sports broadcasts.
